**Aurora Technologies — Adjusting WACC for Corporate Taxes**

```{r}
#| eval: true
#| results: asis
#| echo: false
#| warning: false

set.seed(707)
library(webexercises)
library(knitr)

# Randomized parameters
pre_tax_wacc <- round(rnorm(1, mean = 14, sd = 0.2), 2) / 100
corporate_tax_rate <- 0.25
pre_tax_cost_of_debt <- round(rnorm(1, mean = 7, sd = 0.2), 2) / 100
debt_to_value <- 0.55

# After-tax WACC adjustment
after_tax_wacc <- pre_tax_wacc - (debt_to_value * corporate_tax_rate * pre_tax_cost_of_debt)
```

Solar Technologies currently has a pre-tax WACC of `r round(pre_tax_wacc*100, 1)`%. The corporate tax rate is `r corporate_tax_rate*100`%, and the pre-tax cost of debt is `r round(pre_tax_cost_of_debt*100,1)`%. If the company issues enough debt to reach a debt-to-value ratio of `r debt_to_value`, compute the after-tax WACC (in %).
